answers.author: Bill Atkinson
answers.text:
I don't know about most, but I did an internship under a city manager as part of my MPA requirements and found my calling.  That was 17 years ago, and I do not regret it to this day.  After the internship, I became the city manager of a small community, while finishing my MPA.  I then became the city manager of a small but rapidly growing community in the Dallas Metroplex.  I served there for seven and a half years, and now I am an Assistant City Manager in a city of 70,000 in a suburb of Houston.

answers.author: Albert Tripp
answers.text:
In my case I begin as a city manager intern in my community and transition from Public Works Director to CM.  Most managers I know also started out either as Public Works or Finance Directors.
